BCH210H1-F-20205.courseTitle: Biochemistry I: Proteins, Lipids and Metabolism
BCH210H1-F-20205.courseDescription: Proteins, enzymes, membranes and the metabolism of carbohydrates and lipids. This course is intended for students who are NOT taking BCH242Y1 as part of their program.
BCH210H1-F-20205.prerequisite: Successful completion of (CHM135H1, CHM136H1)/CHM151Y1  NOTE: CHM1** with COURSE EXCLUSION TO CHM135H1 AND CHM136H1 meet the Prerequisite requirement for BCH210H1. CHM110H5 & CHM120H5 (UTM) are equivalent to CHM135H1 ONLY. CHMA10H3 & CHMA11H3 (UTSC) are equivalent to CHM135H1 ONLY. CHMB41H3/CHMB42H3 (UTSC) are equivalent to CHM136H1 ONLY.  CHM242H5 (UTM) is equivalent to CHM136H1 ONLY. Students with a SDF in CHM135H1/CHM136H1 are not permitted to enrol in BCH210H1 until a final passing grade (50%) appears on the transcript.
BCH210H1-F-20205.exclusion: BCH242Y1, [CHM361H5(UTM) and CHM362H5(UTM)], [BIOC12H3(UTSC) and BIOC13H3(UTSC)], CHMB62H3(UTSC)
BCH210H1-F-20205.webTimetableInstructions:
BCH210H1F is an online, asynchronous course administered through Quercus.
Lectures will be delivered asynchronously as pre-recorded online videos available on a weekly basis, with accompanying questions in Quercus.
Weekly quizzes on the content will be available through Quercus for completion on Saturday and Sunday.
Students will have the opportunity to participate in synchronous, online review tutorials 2 hours/week (Wednesday and Fridays 9-10am), where they may ask questions and work through problems using Blackboard Collaborate.
Blackboard Collaborate will also be used for online office hours (2 hours/week, Thursday and Friday, 1-2pm) for assistance with the content and questions regarding the assignments. All material for lectures, tutorials and assignments will be available as downloadable pdf files through Quercus.
In addition to a high speed internet connection for viewing lectures and participating in tutorials, students will also require internet search capability, access to journal articles through the University of Toronto library network, and the ability to complete written assignments in digital format (word processing software). >br/> Students will also have the option of learning protein visualization tools either through the internet or by downloading programs to their personal computers.

BCH299Y1-Y-20205.courseDescription: Credit course for supervised participation in faculty research project. Details at http://www.artsci.utoronto.ca/current/course/rop Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
BCH299Y1-Y-20205.webTimetableInstructions: Enrolment for the Research Opportunity Program (ROP) is processed by Arts and Science. For more information, please see: https://www.artsci.utoronto.ca/current/academics/research-opportunities/research-opportunities-program

BCH311H1-S-20205.courseTitle: Biochemistry II: Nucleic Acids and Biological Information Flow
BCH311H1-S-20205.courseDescription: Nucleic acids and flow of information in biological systems. Information storage and transmission by nucleic acids, as well as new molecular technologies will be discussed. Registration in one of the tutorial sessions is mandatory. Note: Students that have a SDF in BCH210H1 are not permitted to enrol in BCH311H1 until a final passing grade (50%) appears on the transcript. BCH2** WITH COURSE EXCLUSION TO BCH210H1 meets the prerequisite requirement for BCH311H1.
BCH311H1-S-20205.webTimetableInstructions:
NOTE: The course requires a minimum enrolment of 50 to run.
This is an online, asynchronous course.
Lectures will be given as 4hr online videos/week asynchronously.
Students will have the opportunity for synchronous online tutorials 1-2hrs/week (Tuesday and Thursday 9-10am and 1-2pm) to ask questions and clarifications about lecture content.
Students should have the ability to use Blackboard Collaborate (Ultra).

BCH372Y1-Y-20205.courseDescription: Real-world opportunity to apply theoretical knowledge and hone technical skills through full-time research in an active research laboratory for students who have completed second year. Students are responsible for arranging for supervision by a Department of Biochemistry faculty member in advance of the academic year-end. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
BCH372Y1-Y-20205.prerequisite: A final grade of 75% or higher in BCH242Y1 and approval of the course coordinator.
BCH372Y1-Y-20205.webTimetableInstructions: To enrol in this course, please send an email, with your student #, to jennifer.haughton@utoronto.ca

BCH399Y1-Y-20205.courseDescription: Credit course for supervised participation in faculty research project. Details at http://www.artsci.utoronto.ca/current/course/rop. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
BCH399Y1-Y-20205.webTimetableInstructions: Enrolment for the Research Opportunity Program is done by Arts and Science. For more information, please see: https://www.artsci.utoronto.ca/current/academics/research-opportunities/research-opportunities-program

BCH472Y1-Y-20205.courseTitle: Advanced Summer Research Project in Biochemistry
BCH472Y1-Y-20205.courseDescription: Real-world opportunity to apply theoretical knowledge and hone technical skills through full-time research in an active research laboratory for students who have completed third year. Students are responsible for arranging for supervision by a Department of Biochemistry faculty member in advance of the academic year-end. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
BCH472Y1-Y-20205.prerequisite: A final grade of 75% or higher in each of BCH340H1; BCH377H1; BCH378H1; and approval of the course coordinator.
BCH472Y1-Y-20205.webTimetableInstructions: To enrol in this course, please send an email, with your student #, to jennifer.haughton@utoronto.ca
